oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Return of commissary property received, issued, and remaining on hand at Chickamauga
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Chickamauga (Ga.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Account of various stationery items issued, expended, and on hand from July 14 - September 30, 1863. Includes dates issued, amounts issued, items issued, amount expended, and balances on hand. Items include paper, blank books, pen holders, desks, and tables. Account issued by B. J. Semmes.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Quartermaster General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Quartermaster of the Army provides logistical support to the combat troops in the form of ammunition, clothing, food, and pay. The Battle of Chickamauga took place during the quarter listed on this account, September 19 - 20, 1863. The battle resulted in a Confederate victory, but it was quickly reversed by a Federal victory in the Chattanooga Campaign in October - November 1863.
